H0.text: It makes most students understand how to write a good story, which is how word processors on computers benefit them.

H1.text: It helps most students gather historical information.

H2.text: It exposes most students to data that is hard to find when they use word processors on computers.

H3.text: Word processors on computers allow most students to edit papers quickly.

A4.text: Google Docs also enabled the significant growth of use of information technology such as remote access to files and collaborative realâ€‘time editing, both becoming simple to do with little or no need for costly software and specialist IT support.

A5.text: The functions of a word processor program are typically between those of a simple text editor and a desktop publishing program; many word processing programs have gained advanced features over time providing similar functionality to desktop publishing programs.
